Merge pull request #9 from stelian42/arduino-fixes

Arduino fixes
ensure current heading is set when ap is enabled
improve control to work with servo only
increase buffer size and fix message

Implement volts/amps correction by offset and gain compensation.

The offset and gain values are stored in EEPROM and can be modified
by the clients using special codes.

In addition, a few other parameters (max controller temp,
max motor temp, rudder range, max slew) are also stored in EEPROM
making the controller safe even if no client is connected.

Conflicts:
	arduino/motor/motor.ino
improve signature logic and eeprom writes

UI and core changes to support the current/voltage correction.

Since the correction parameters are stored into the controller's flash,
we do not want the same behaviour as for the max_xxx parameters, which
are always send on startup from pypilot to the controller.

Instead, we want to retrieve first the stored values, and only then
allow modifications from the UI which needs to be send back to the
controller.

Conflicts:
	pypilot/arduino_servo/arduino_servo.cpp

More changes to support the saving of parameters inside the controller's EEPROM

max_current, max_controller_temp, max_motor_temp, min/max_rudder_pos,
max_slew_speed/slow are now stored inside the controller's EEPROM.

The UI allows configuration of all these parameters, except for the
rudder position (the rudder calibration process is not yet implemented).
